results.title: Child of urban Thailand: a place to live
results.creator_credit: Don Whyte, World Vision of New Zealand and South Pacific Television
results.brief_description: Highlights a day in the life of a ten-year-old boy who lives in the slums of Bangkok, Thailand. Examines the problems of rural people who have moved to the city without job skills or money. Motivates discussion about the rights and responsibilities of children in different types of family and community situations. Helps to build understanding and appreciation of other cultures. Stimulates concern for children who are denied basic rights and opportunities. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Child's play: window on development
results.creator_credit: Harcourt Brace Jovanovich and Vision Associates
results.brief_description: Shows four types of play, including social, dramatic, sensory, and skill mastery, and levels of attainment from infancy through adolescence. Narrated by Sandra Scarr-Salapatek.

results.title: Chief telegraph office
results.brief_description: Uses period footage and oral history interviews to trace the 133 years of telegraphy in Victoria, from the Eureka stockade rebellion and the bombing of Darwin to the private joys and sorrows of births, deaths and marriages.

results.title: Chicago blues
results.creator_credit: Harley Cokeliss and Irit Film Production
results.brief_description: Provides an account of the evolution of blues music from its origins in the rural south of America to the contemporary electric sound shaped in the ghettos of Chicago. The harsh experiences of blacks in America and the liberation they found through music are delineated through archival footage, interviews and performances by musicians at home or in Southside clubs. Features amongst others, Muddy Waters, Junior Wells, Floyd Jones, J.B.Hutto and Dick Gregory. This film is suitable for tertiary levels.

results.title: Chiapas Army Base occupation (Mexico) Jan 1, 2001
results.brief_description: This astounding testimony to ‘the power of the people’ was given to the Memory Grid Community Collection as part of the SKA TV video compile ‘Global Insights 4’, a collection of shorts from around the world with a focus on grass-roots peoples’ action. Chiapas Army Base (Mexico) was filmed by Big Noise Tactical (USA) a not-for-profit, all-volunteer collective of media-makers around the world, ‘dedicated to circulating beautiful, passionate, revolutionary images.’

results.title: Chemistry of soapless detergents
results.creator_credit: Sam Napier-Bell, George Seager, Unilever Films and De La Chevre Films
results.brief_description: Explains the molecular reaction between water and soapless detergent; molecules; research on the process of synthetization from petrol hydrocarbons. Laboratory demonstration of the production of Alkylbenzene sulphonate basis for a whole range of soapless detergent products for domestic use. Large scale production methods are also shown.

results.title: Chemistry for sixth forms: catalysis
results.creator_credit: Phil Wrestler, Donald Carter and Associated Television
results.brief_description: The term “catalysis” and its importance in industrial processes; homogeneous and heterogeneous catalysis; catalytic cracking of petroleum; Faraday’s theory on the cause of surface catalysis; Sabatier-Senderens process using nickel as a catalyst in hydrogenation of vegetable oils; effect of poisons on surface catalysis; effect of manganese dioxide on hydrogen peroxide.
